halloween1.description: Nana was here this weekend.  She got us a pumpkin, just for decoration. Milo got really excited that Halloween was finally here! He dressed up, and waited for the action to begin.
halloween1.title: Halloween 1

halloween2.description: So, in celebration of pre-Halloween, we carved a Jack o' Lantern.
halloween2.title: Halloween 2

halloween3.description: Milo insisted on trick or treating. Felix played the role of the adult: he opened the door and put candy in Milo's basket.
halloween3.title: Halloween 3

kidgym.description:
Milo is enrolled in a gym class. Mostly he runs from the trampoline to the rings to the balancing beam, etc, paying no attention to the activity the instructor is trying to coach.

The class is for 2 year olds. But this week Felix joined us. He had so much fun, and he was so good at letting all the little ones go first ("they don't like to wait", he explains), that the instructor let him become a permanent member of the class.
kidgym.title: Kidgym

mentosdietcoke1.description: Do you know what happens when you drop 3 Mentos in a jug of Diet Coke?
mentosdietcoke1.title: Mentosdietcoke 1

mentosdietcoke2.title: Mentosdietcoke 2

mentosdietcoke3.description: When you do it right, you get an impressive spray.

walk.description: Milo can now walk fairly long distance without getting distracted by every little thing or running into the street. Here, we took a walk to our local toy shop, Mr. Mopps.
walk.title: Walk

description:
We've been meaning to comment on how international New School is. Just in Milo's class of 12 kids, the languages spoken at home include French, German, Italian, Polish, Swedish and Spanish. Some parents even speak English.

The other day, scientist Felix said, "I have a plan for how babies grow inside their mom's belly. I am going to tell you my plan, and you tell me if I am right. I think the food the mom eats falls into the belly where the baby is, and the baby eats it. Is that a good plan?". It's cool to see Felix coming up with theories and understanding that they are just theories, and that he needs to verify them. We explained to him the finer details of digestion, blood circulation and fetal growth.

This Sunday there was a big bianca picnic in Tilden Park. It was great to see so many old friends. We've known each other for about 10 years now. Most of us don't go to Burning Man anymore, or throw giant parties. Some of us have kids. Relationships have ended and started. Careers have changed. People moved, bought houses. We are all looking like grown ups. Time is flowing by.
title: October 1
